summary: This is a take on the FXAA Post Processor that alters Preset 1 in a way that doesn\'t wash the colours out, isn\'t too dark, isn\'t too saturated and isn\'t any laggier than vanilla. Recommended for Mid-range PC users. The detail is great and the world comes alive.
descriptionHtml:
Cezton\'s FXAA Profile

I\'m running an E8400 and a GTX 460 SE and I\'m quite pleased in the appearance and performance of these settings. It took weeks of picking at everything to get them quite right, so I hope they benefit others as well.

This profile is meant to bring out the perfect blend of sharpening, anti-aliasing, texture mod-use and best saturation for the world of Skyrim. If you set your in-game brightness 2-3 ticks ahead of the middle point there will be no brightness issue using this profile.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How to Install:

Drag files from zip archive to program files/steam/steamapps/common/skyrim or 
program files/bethesda/skyrim

(The folder that contains SkyrimLauncher)

Run Skyrim Launcher and set your desired settings.


Mods Used:

4GB Skyrim - Performance boost. Recommended to all with 4GB of RAM.

Realistic Water Textures 1 Point 5b
Enhanced Night Skyrim - Galaxy
Serious HD Retexture Landscape Skyrim
Vurts Skyrim Flora Overhaul - Sparkling Branches
Improved Rock and Mountain Textures


Additional:

Go to Documents/My Games/Skyrim/SkyrimPrefs.ini

Change the following:

fShadowDistance = 4000 (Mine) Alternatively you can drop the quality to as low as 1-2k for an FPS boost
bTreesReceiveShadows = Change from 0 to 1 for increased shadow depth on trees
uiMaxSkinnedTreesToRender= Change to 80, fps drop is small
iMaxDesired = Change to 300 (Change to 100 in caves with a lot of particles if you experience lag)
iWaterReflectHeight= Change to 1024 for better water
iWaterReflectWidth = Same as Above
author: Cezton
